alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Eastern Hanover; Eastern Henrico; Western Chesterfield; Western Hanover; Western Henrico (Including the City of Richmond); Western King William (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 23 at 3:11PM EDT until September 23 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of northeast North Carolina, including the following area, Northampton. Portions of Virginia, including the following areas, Brunswick, Caroline, Charles City, Dinwiddie, Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights), Eastern Essex, Eastern Hanover, Eastern Henrico, Eastern King William, Eastern King and Queen, Greensville, New Kent, Prince George, Sussex, Western Chesterfield, Western Essex, Western Hanover, Western Henrico (Including the City of Richmond), Western King William and Western King and Queen. * WHEN...Through Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Periods of heavy rain are expected to continue through tonight as Tropical Storm Ophelia continues to move north. Storm total rainfall of 3 to 6 inches is expected with locally higher totals possible. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
